file_content.text: That was Grand Master Satele, wasn't it?
Currently acting as emissary to the Drayvos League. Nowhere near Tython.
We aren't close, of course. Your order is pretty particular on that point.
She gave you up when you were a child, then?
Not that I'm complaining. You Jedi have your rules, and it turns out I don't have your talent anyway. Everything's worked out for the best.
The rules of our order are important, but that doesn't mean they're easy to live by. It's good that you hold no resentment.
That's good to hear.
There are more important things in life than wallowing in past troubles. More than enough to deal with in the present.
If you ask me, you turned out pretty well.
[Flirt] I'd say so.
I hope that means you're willing to hear me out a bit, then.
In my experience, most "Jedi rules" only stand in the way of getting things done.
I've never liked rules.
Then you're not like any of the other Jedi I've met.
We aren't exactly close; the Jedi don't much care for family dynamics. Doesn't mean I can't check up on her, though.
If you're her son, why weren't you raised as a Jedi?
I was, actually. But I don't have their particular talent, so I found... other employment. Honestly, I'd say things have worked out just fine.
Most people don't have "interplanetary super-spy" as their backup career. Do you enjoy it?
What do you think of the SIS?
Sometimes. But you end up dealing with a lot of lies in this business.
If you ask me, you turned out pretty well.
[Flirt] I'd say so.
Then I'm guessing you won't mind staying and hearing me out a bit.
The Jedi have too many rules. That's no way to live life.
You're definitely better off.
I guess a soldier would know a bit about rules. But that isn't what I asked you here to talk about.
I'm not sure you've spent enough time around any rules to have a fair impression of them, Captain. But that isn't what I asked you here to talk about.
Even without the Force, I know when things don't add up. These ops, Colonel Darok... something's being buried here. I'm sure of it.
But the real question is, are you going to take your shiny medal and go home like Darok's hoping, or are you ready to start digging?
If you were to do some digging, where exactly would you start?
What do you have in mind?
You were just as involved in all of this as the colonel. Maybe you're working for him. Pretending to be an ally to see how much I know already.
I'm not sure I can trust you.
I'm not saying this wasn't all a bit strange, but looking at our own people? You're jumping at shadows.
Don't be paranoid.
That's what I do for a living.
I'd start by recruiting someone I could count on. Someone who'd be willing to face down the Emperor himself if it came to it.
I'd start by recruiting someone I trusted. Someone insightful, who could always find the truth of things.
I'd start by recruiting someone with experience in black ops. Someone who's spent time sniffing out traitors would be a plus.
I'd start by recruiting someone outside the system. Someone who's used to working outside the lines, around the edges.
Then, I'd find out everything I could about Darok and that Sith Lord you talked to. See if there are any connections.
And then, once I found something, I'd contact my new friend and we'd get to the bottom of all this. But this is all just speaking hypothetically, of course.
Of course.
Been great chatting with you. We'll have to do it again sometime. See you around.
Wow. And I was worried you wouldn't be suspicious enough.
You don't have to do anything if you don't want to. But I'm going to learn everything I can about Darok and that Sith Lord you talked to.
When I find something, I'll contact you. Then you can decide whether you want in on the fun. Fair enough?
Fair enough.
Then I'll be seeing you.
